dcterms:description: The linear algebra subroutines in the Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms (BLAS) form the backbone of scientific computing, with Level 3 operations being the most complex and computationally demanding.
dcterms:title: BLAS Level 3 Operations

dcterms:creator: R. C. Whaley
J. J. Dongarra
dcterms:description: Automatically tuned linear algebra software that optimizes linear algebra operations by searching over parameters like blocking factor, loop order, and partial storage location.
dcterms:title: ATLAS

dcterms:creator: J. C´amara
J. Cuenca
L.-P. Garc´ıa
D. Gim´enez
dcterms:description: Empirical modelling of linear algebra shared-memory routines, focusing on optimizing the number of threads or block size based on empirical features.
dcterms:title: PLASMA

dcterms:creator: Y. Xia
M. De La Pierre
A. S. Barnard
G. M. J. Barca
dcterms:description: A machine learning approach towards runtime optimization of matrix multiplication, predicting the best number of threads for each operation based on matrix dimensions and system architecture.
dcterms:title: Machine Learning Models for BLAS L3 Operations

dcterms:creator: M. Mascagni
H. Chi
dcterms:description: A study on the scrambled Halton sequence, which is used for quasi-random sampling in various applications.
dcterms:title: Scrambled Halton Sequence
